data.question: What is React?
data.options1: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
data.options2: A programming language

data.question: What is JSX?
data.options1: JavaScript XML
data.options2: Java Syntax Extension

data.question: What is the purpose of ReactDOM in React?
data.options1: To render React components in the DOM
data.options2: To manage state in React components
data.options3: To handle HTTP requests in React
data.options4: To provide routing functionality in React

data.question: What are components in React?
data.options1: Reusable pieces of code
data.options2: Functions or classes that may accept inputs and return React elements

data.question: Which method is used to change the state of a component in React?
data.options1: setState()
data.options2: changeState()

data.question: What is the purpose of props in React?
data.options1: To pass data from parent to child components
data.options2: To handle events in React components
data.options3: To define the structure of a component
data.options4: To define CSS styles for a component

data.question: What is the virtual DOM in React?
data.options1: A lightweight representation of the actual DOM
data.options2: A concept used in functional programming
data.options3: A component in React used for routing
data.options4: A feature to create dynamic elements in React

data.question: What is the purpose of keys in React lists?
data.options1: To identify unique list items
data.options2: To style list items

data.options1: To perform actions after the component is rendered
data.options2: To update the component's state

data.question: What is the purpose of setState() in React?

data.options2: To define the initial state of the component

data.question: What is the purpose of React Router?
data.options1: To provide routing functionality in React applications
data.options2: To manage state in React components

data.question: What is a controlled component in React?
data.options1: A component that controls other components
data.options2: A component that manages its own state
data.options3: A component that receives data from props
data.options4: A component that renders static content

data.question: What is the purpose of the render() method in React?
data.options1: To define the initial state of the component
data.options2: To update the component's state

data.question: What is the purpose of componentWillUnmount() lifecycle method in React?
data.options1: To perform cleanup actions before the component is removed from the DOM

data.question: What is the purpose of PropTypes in React?
data.options1: To define the type of props passed to a component

data.options1: To map dispatch functions to props in React components
